title: Question 5
prompt: The largest population of Africans in the Western Hemisphere is in Brazil, where the population is 38.5% mulatto (over 72 million) and 6.2% black (over 11 million). Based on the information above, what is likely to be true about the Brazilian slave trade?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
Answer Explanation: The passage shows a relationship between the number of African slaves during slavery and the black population today. Many African slaves equates to a large percentage of the black population today. Since Brazil has a large black population today, Brazil likely had a large number of African slaves.

By 1800, African slaves outnumbered European settlers by an estimated 300,000 to 30,000. Today, Jamaica’s population is 90.9% black, reflecting this colonial demographic.
